reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Managing Access to Unused Logging Roads: A Practical Means to Protecting Tiger Prey Populations in Primorye, Russia

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes 'The purpose of this proposal is to demonstrate measurable changes in human access and wildlife population numbers, particularly ungulates, resulting from logging road closures in order to prove the effectiveness of closures for tiger conservation. This would be done by: (a) closing unused logging roads; (b) measuring changes in wildlife populations; (c) measuring changes in human use; (d) designing closures that facilitate effective law enforcement; and (e) promoting road closures as a necessary component of FSC certification. Specifically the applicant would select six roads within the Maksimovka River drainage and close three of these roads once the ground thaws in the spring 2013 and then (a) measure changes in wildlife populations; (2) measure changes in human use; (3) design closures that facilitate effective law enforcement; and (4) promote road closures as a necessary component of FSC certification.'. The purpose of this proposal is to demonstrate measurable changes in human access and wildlife population numbers, particularly ungulates, resulting from logging road closures in order to prove the effectiveness of closures for tiger conservation. This would be done by: (a) closing unused logging roads; (b) measuring changes in wildlife populations; (c) measuring changes in human use; (d) designing closures that facilitate effective law enforcement; and (e) promoting road closures as a necessary component of FSC certification. Specifically the applicant would select six roads within the Maksimovka River drainage and close three of these roads once the ground thaws in the spring 2013 and then (a) measure changes in wildlife populations; (2) measure changes in human use; (3) design closures that facilitate effective law enforcement; and (4) promote road closures as a necessary component of FSC certification..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. assistance programs are designed to promote Russia’s role as a stable, democratic, and reliable partner in addressing crucial global issues, to support U.S.-Russian cooperation in areas of common interest, to advance priorities outlined by the Bilateral Presidential Commission (BPC) Working Groups, and to develop partnerships that leverage Russia’s considerable resources in solving domestic and international problems. At the same time, the United States will support Russian organizations that encourage the adoption of policies and practices that promote democratic norms on issues such as human rights, civil society, and the rule of law. Programs under the Peace and Security objective will complement broader U.S. Government efforts under the Cooperative Threat Reduction Program to enhance nuclear cooperation and reduce the threat of proliferation of weapons of mass destruction (WMD). Secretary Clinton noted that the coming years will be crucial for Russian democracy, as Russians from all walks of life make their voices heard and express their hopes for the future. Programs under the Governing Justly and Democratically objective will promote U.S. interests in a strong, politically vibrant, open, democratic Russia, as well as deepening the U.S.-Russian partnership. Resources will also help fight the transnational threats of epidemic disease, such as multi-drug-resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB). (Source: Congressional Budget Justification FY 2013)

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Multinational Species Conservation Fund, United States Fish and Wildlife Service
